+# ==============================================================================
+
+"""Seq2seq loss operations for use in neural networks.
+"""
+
+from __future__ import absolute_import
+from __future__ import division
+from __future__ import print_function
+
+from tensorflow.python.framework import dtypes
+from tensorflow.python.ops import array_ops
+from tensorflow.python.ops import math_ops
+
+__all__ = ["decoder_fn_train",
+           "decoder_fn_eval_wrapper"]
+
+def simple_decoder_fn_train(encoder_state):
+
+  def decoder_fn(time, cell_state, cell_output, context_state):
+    if cell_state == None: # first call, return encoder_state
+      return (None, encoder_state, None, cell_output, context_state)
+    else:
+      return (None, cell_state, None, cell_output, context_state)
+  return decoder_fn
+
+
+def simple_decoder_fn_inference(encoder_state, embeddings,
+                                start_of_sequence_id, end_of_sequence_id,
+                                maximum_length, dtype=dtypes.int32):
+  start_of_sequence_id = array_ops.constant(start_of_sequence_id, dtype=dtype)
body:
please use ops.convert_to_tensor everywhere instead of array_ops.constant.

similarly remove the dtype= argument here.
